p: There are additional factors that contribute to the potential distribution of human cases, including irrigated croplands, build-up land, grassland and percentage of water bodies, which were considered as important driver for the risk of human infection, probably by affecting the human behaviour. Percentage of water bodies, on the other hand, was considered as a potential factor in affecting the viral transmission to a specific region by the long-distance flying of the migratory birds, as had been previously hypothesized [ 48].
